description: Identifying string linked to a particular sample or specimen, provide by the data contributor.
Stage of the experimental design.
valid values: Discovery, Replication, Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Number of individuals in a group.Example: 2000

The type of sample collected or the term used to describe the source of a biospecimen used for a laboratory test.Provide a value OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specifiedThe sample types are adopted from Uberon, Cell and ChEBI ontologies.

description: Was a reagent applied to the sample?
One or more identifiers, separated by a semicolon (;). The reagent identifier(s) must be stored in a data dictionary .csv file uploaded to Synapse.
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: The reagent name is an alternative to the Reagent ID.
The manufacturer is the source of a reagent and may include commercial vendors as well as non-commercial sources (e.g., collaborating labs).
If the assay reagent is a commercial product, enter the vendor's catalog identifier. If the reagent is a custom preparation enter 'NA'.
The lot number is often provided by a reagent source when the reagent is replenished over time.
An internet address that may provide details of an assay reagent.
The contact information is particularly helpful when the reagent is not from a commercial vendor.
Was a treatment applied to the sample?
One or more identifiers, separated by a semicolon (;). The treatment identifier(s) must be stored in a data dictionary .csv file uploaded to Synapse.
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Treatments refer to in vitro modifications of samples. Three treatment types are supported: agent amount, duration, and temperature.  The treatment name is an alternate identifier to the Treatment ID.
The Amount Value indicates how much (concentration, mass, volume) of a treatment agent was applied to a sample.
Unit of treatment amount.
valid values: AFU, AI, AU/ml, DK units/ml, g/dl, g/l, gm, HAU, IU, iu/l, IU/ml, Kallikrein Inactivator Unit per Milliliter, kg, l, M, mg, mg/dl, mg/l, mg/ml, miu/ml, ml, mM, MOI, ng, ng/dl, ng/ml, ng/nl, ng/ul, nl, nM, Not Specified, NPX, optical density, other, PFU, PFUe, pg, pg/mg creatinine, pg/ml, pg/nl, pg/ul, pl, pM, Pound, TCID50, ug, ug/dl, ug/l, ug/ml, ug/ul, uiu/ml, ul, uM, umol/l, units/ml

description: Duration of treatment.
Unit of treatment duration.
valid values: d.p.c., Days, Hours, Minutes, Months, Not Specified, Seconds, Weeks, Years

description: Value of treatment temperature.
Unit of treatment temperature.
The name of the measurement technique describing the assay method.Provide a value OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Method(s) used to genotype variants in the discovery stage. Separate multiple methods separated by a semicolon (;).Example: genome-wide genotyping array, exome-wide sequencing, targeted genotyping array
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Manufacturer of the genotyping array used for the discovery stage. Separate multiple manufacturers by a semicolon (;).Example: Illumina, Affymetrix, Perlegen
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Additional information about the genotyping array. For example, for targeted arrays, please provide the specific type of array.Example: Immunochip
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Were SNPs imputed for the discovery GWAS?
Panel used for imputation.Example: 1000 Genomes Phase 3
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Imputation software.Example: IMPUTE
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: The number of variants analysed in the discovery stage (after QC).Example: 52500
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: A brief description of the statistical model used to determine association significance. It is important to distinguish studies that would otherwise appear identical (e.g., the same trait analyzed using additive, dominant, and recessive models).Example: additive model
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Any covariates the GWAS is adjusted for. Multiple values can be listed separately by a semicolon (;).Example: age;sex
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: The trait under investigation. Please describe the trait concisely but with enough detail to be clear to a non-specialist. Avoid the use of abbreviations; if these are necessary, please define them or their source in the readme file.Example: Reticulocyte count
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Any background trait(s) shared by all individuals in the GWAS (e.g. in both cases and controls).Example: Nicotine dependence
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Was a readme file uploaded to Synapse?
The name of any readme file uploaded to Synapse.Example: example.tsv
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Was a summary statitics file uploded to Synapse?
The name of any summary statistics file uploaded to Synapse.Example: example.tsv
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified

description: Genome assembly for the summary statistics.Example: GRCh38
note: A data contributor should be able to write in a name OR provide one of these values: Unknown Not collected, Not applicable, Not specified
